ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 24 Pet, and related questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually every pet got the delay no matter what the level when you handed it a lower delay weapon.  If you stack on the 39th lvl augment death on top of the
ygData.messageBody:
Actually every pet got the delay no matter what the level when you handed it
a lower delay weapon. If you stack on the 39th lvl augment death on top of
the lower delay weapons then yes, you would of noticed a big difference in
the speed from 39th on up.

But this is all moot now, ah the past.

-----Original Message-----
From: Naeeldar [mailto:jackal@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 28, 2000 1:01 PM
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 24 Pet, and related questions


From: "Naeeldar" <jackal@...>

Heh it only really got the dly increase at 44 and 49 where you dish more
damage but with a higher dly. Somewhat 39 but for the most part it only
affected the 44 and 49 pets.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Barry Senowitz <barrys@...>
To: 'EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com' <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, March 28, 2000 10:38 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 24 Pet, and related questions


>From: Barry Senowitz <barrys@...>
>
>At 29th level you can give your pet any 2 1 hand weapons and he will dual
>weild. Not only were we screwed with the 2 weapon requirement, but we used
>to be able to hand our pet a weapon with a delay lower than 30 and it would
>use that delay, but no more.
>
>Aren't enchancements great!!!!
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Hu Anderson [mailto:as4603rosand@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, March 28, 2000 10:28 AM
>To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 24 Pet, and related questions
>
>
>From: "Hu Anderson" <as4603rosand@...>
>
>OK so do you need to still give you pet 2 different weapons to get dual
>wield or will 2 rusty daggers get dual wield now?
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Trizzen Do'Trevan" <trizzen@...>
>To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
>Sent: Tuesday, March 28, 2000 10:00 AM
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 24 Pet, and related questions
>
>
>> From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
>>
>>
>> > First off, what level of pet is it possible to
>> > summon with the level 24 pet
>> > spell (Haunting Corpse).
>>
>> I really don't remember the levels per say...
>>
>> > Reason I ask is this:
>> > last night I'm camping
>> > Ratraz in Neriak. I summon my top pet, which hits
>> > for a max of 22. My
>> > friend dings into level 24 and summons his new, sexy
>> > :), dark-boned
>> > skeleton. It conned a higher blue to me than my top
>> > pet......but it never
>> > hit for more than 22! What gives? Did he just
>> > happen to summon a sucky
>> > one?
>>
>> Exactly. He had a bad summon.
>>
>>
>>
>> > Next question, deals with weapons for pets. I know
>> > that recently our pets
>> > were nerfed in this department. I know we have to
>> > give our level 29 pets 2
>> > weapons in order to duel wield. What type of
>> > weapons do you recommend?
>>
>> There are two types to give to pets. Weapons that
>> process, and weapons that do not. If you give a pet a
>> weapons that processes(dnoll hide lariat, mage
>> summoned sword), then the pet will process in battle
>> and do extra damage. Any other weapon makes no
>> difference what so ever. Rusty, low damage, high
>> damae, low speed, high speed, it makes no difference
>> what so ever. However, with the recent weapon change,
>> the pet will sometimes "eat" a weapon. You give it a
>> weapon, and it does not show up as a graphic, and pet
>> does not double hit. You need to give the pet another
>> weapon.
>>
>> > And, should I NOT give my level 24 pet a weapon?
>>
>> At that level, unless you give it a gigantic
>> zweihander or something along those lines, I would not
>> bother giving the pet a weapon. Unless you want to go
>> for looks. A pet with a shield makes a nice "bonk"
>> sound when bashing. :)
>>
>> Darkmoon Somberlight
>>
>>
